title: mysql db problem - new item creation impossible
author: omarie56
body_snippet:
Hi,

I used mysql to store mremote configuration file. Every thing work fine since a few months

I just notice that since a few days it is impossible for me to create new items. for exemple i want to duplicate and entry and i get this error message "cannot save connection file as ""! the data key was missing from the dictionary"

changes are not backup in mysql database

In preferences menu, when i chek my mysql connexion every thing is OK

My mremote version 1.77.2.4127
My Mysql vers...

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet: will fix a bit later, due settings rearrangement this is a bit not right.

comments.author: BastyJuice
comments.snippet:
Thanks how long will this take i know this is opensoruce but i cant work anymore with the manager, would be very nice if this will get updatet soon

thanks for your work

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet: nb should be soon, and if all ok in October should be working.

comments.author: BastyJuice
comments.snippet:
also present on 1.77.1, anyway thank you very much

short note for 1.77.2 the settings are not saved in the Directory of the Portalbe version that is not optimal for portable version

comments.author: SOlangsam
comments.snippet: @BastyJuice Please check #2298 if it works for you.

comments.author: BastyJuice
comments.snippet: It does not Help if you change somthing db is empty

comments.author: SOlangsam
comments.snippet: I have made a PR because of some missing fields. After the change inserts, modify, copies (duplicates) and deletes works as expected. You can have a look.

comments.author: BastyJuice
comments.snippet: ook where i ccan find the PR

comments.author: omarie56
comments.snippet:
thanks, but you sql command is only for a new fresh mremonte install no ? What about for an existing tbscons table with content inside.

When i apply you sql command we get the mesage "#1050 - table 'tblCons' already exist"

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet: Triage (P3 stale status): this issue is labeled as actively worked, but activity appears stale. Please confirm whether work is still in progress. If not, please relabel to Need 2 check (or close) to keep status labels accurate.

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet:
Triage refresh (P4 version-label debt): this issue is tagged with legacy version labels. Please retest on the latest build (fork v1.79.x or upstream dev), then share reproducible steps and expected vs actual behavior. If still valid, keep open and relabel to current triage scope (for example Need 2 check). If fixed, close with resolution.

Current legacy version labels: 1.77.3

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet:
Follow-up triage note: this backlog item appears related to historical MySQL schema mismatch problems and references PR #2298, which was merged in 2022. 
 
I also pushed an additional compatibility hardening patch in my fork for partial/outdated SQL schemas: 
https://github.com/robertpopa22/mRemoteNG/commit/cd6eee37 
CI green (x86/x64/ARM64): https://github.com/robertpopa22/mRemoteNG/actions/runs/21786116643 
 
Please retest against current upstream dev and/or latest fork build and confirm...
